context: Beyoncé Giselle Knowles was born in Houston, Texas, to Celestine Ann "Tina" Knowles (née Beyincé), a <a5_0>hairdresser and <a9_0>salon<a9_0/> owner<a5_0/>, and Mathew Knowles, a <a4_0><a8_0>Xerox<a8_0/><a4_0/> sales manager. Beyoncé's name is a tribute to <a1_0>her mother's maiden name<a1_0/>. Beyoncé's younger sister <a6_0><a10_0>Solange<a10_0/><a6_0/> is also a singer and a former member of <a0_0>Destiny's Child<a0_0/>. Mathew is <a2_0>African-American<a2_0/>, while Tina is of Louisiana Creole descent (with African, Native American, French, Cajun, and distant Irish and Spanish ancestry). Through her mother, Beyoncé is a descendant of Acadian leader <a7_0><a11_0>Joseph Broussard<a7_0/>.<a11_0/> She was raised in a <a3_0><a12_0>Methodist<a12_0/><a3_0/> household.
